cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi south of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north, then turning north-northwest across the Bahamas and toward the Florida east coast late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible close approach/landfall along the Florida east coast between Palm Beach and Cape Canaveral

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, Bahamas, Florida east coast, Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) are likely at Port Everglades with a 61 % chance; hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) cannot be ruled out if the center tracks close to shore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Major hurricane passing just offshore could drive 3–5 ft of surge into the Port Everglades area, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could deliver 4–8 inches of rain with localized higher totals, creating flash-flooding risk inside the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large battering waves, dangerous surf and rip currents, and possible channel shoaling may disrupt pilotage and terminal operations.
